title: How to prepare for the UPSC public administration optional subject? Which are the best resources for the same - Quora
tags: Union Public Service Commission of India

response.answer_text: Strategies for Public Administration Be thorough with the basic books and concepts The Pub Ad is difficult is optional which needs more analysis and hard work. So, you should go thorough with the basic concepts, theories, and principles. Without conceptual clarity, You can not fetch good score in Pub Ad optional exam. Makes some short notes You should make good notes on the topics which ever they have covered. Even you can make notes after 2-3 readings. Later on, you can club the topics together accordingly., like clubbing the chapters like civil services and personnel management etc. All topics are interlinked and some or in another way it will help you especially during revision. This will help you to get a comprehensive idea about the topics. Study optional regularly You should not ignore optional subjects. Along with the General Studies, You should study the optional subject on a daily basis. Daily for two-three hours you should spend for the optional subject, especially for Pub Ad. Remember the quotes from thinkers Citing quotes from thinkers and personalities in the UPSC IAS Mains examination will help you to fetch good score in Pub Ad optional. The quotes are key to score well in Pub Ad. Answer writing practice and Test series It is very important to join test series. The test series for Pub ad optional will help you to gain new knowledge, widen the analyzing skill etc. Along with that you will learn how to manage the time also. This will certainly help you in a UPSC IAS Mains examination. Previous year questions The previous year question paper is the best sources for UPSC exam preparation. You should solve at least past four years UPSC question paper. You have to read a question and try to frame the answer. Framing the answer like a Pub ad student by including quotes from thinkers, concepts according to the need of the question.Then, you should jot down the answer in a notebook below the question. Approach like a Pub Ad Student If you are a candidate who has opted Public Administration as an optional subject for IAS Mains Exam then irrespective of whether you are from the same subject background or not, it is recommended to you to approach the questions in a right method. As candidates may tend to approach this optional paper similarly as they would attempt the General Studies Papers and this would not fetch them a good score in the subject. Hence, as a Civil Services Exam beginner with the same subject background or not one should understand the question and attempt to answer the question using proper citing of theories and pub ad concepts which will definitely fetch them a good score. Books for Pub Ad Paper I Administrative Thinkers by Prasad and PrasadPublic Administration: Administrative Theories and Concepts by Fadia & FadiaPublic Administration and Public Affairs 12th Edition – Nicholas HenryMohit Bhattacharya- New horizons in Public administrationMohit Bhattacharya- Pub Ad A new lookPublic Administration: Concepts and Theories by Basu RumkiIGNOU BooksARC ReportsBooks for Pub Ad Paper II Indian Administration – Ramesh K. Arora & Rajni GoyalYojanaNewspaperARCs and committee reportsStrategy for answer writing Do not write here as you write in GS. They should be ‘Pub Ad’ answers. Use administrative terminology from the subject; quote thinkers and theories in your answer; and explore the issue on administrative lines. As for an example, if a question on reducing the size of Indian Cabinet comes, you should be able to write its positive and negative implications based on delegation and decentralization; efficiency; organizational behaviour; informal grouping angle etc.Try to relate your answer with the basic theories, contemporary and cross-cultural practices. For e.g. in comparing the strength of executive accountability to legislature, compare that of US and India. You can also quote that in 2013 US Congress stopped fund flow to the executive. Such financial control is difficult to achieve in India given the dominance of executive in the Indian Parliament.Also, try to cover almost any answer right from its basics. For e.g. if a question on comparison between Bernard and Simon comes, you should first clearly state what both thinkers claim, and then explore similarities or dissimilarities.Try to use the quotes, committees, reports in your answer.And most importantly, don’t use the complicated language rather than use a simple language.You should state the concept clearly and take a fair stand on issues by giving appropriate logic and evidence from both sides.That’s all, i can say. Thank you.
